==Social, legal and psychological views on necrophilia==
==Social, legal and psychological views on necrophilia==
===Consensuality issue===
===Consensuality issue===
â
Although non-living material is not usually considered to be capable of, or require [[consent]], necrophilia is an exception to the rule in many people's eyes. A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive and that it would ocnstitute a profound and disturbing disrespect to them, and concern for others, for their remains to be treated in a way other than their presumed wishes.
+
Although non-living material is not usually considered to be capable of, or require [[consent]], necrophilia is an exception to the rule in many people's eyes. A sexual act with a corpse is generally considered socially unacceptable; the presumption being that the person would not have consented to the act while alive and that it would constitute a profound and disturbing disrespect to them, and concern for others, for their remains to be treated in a way other than their presumed wishes.
Virtually all human [[society|societies]] condemn abuse of the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect. In rare cases, however, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him.
Virtually all human [[society|societies]] condemn abuse of the dead as a form of symbolic disrespect. In rare cases, however, necrophiliac acts can be consensual: for example, in the [[Armin Meiwes]] case, the victim gave his consent to the mutilation and death inflicted upon him.
